column4: hi guys - quick question - i added the 1400x1050 resolution to the xorg.conf but it is not showing up in the GUI resolution options - any idea why?
did you restart X already?
yah
I did gdm stop / start
it's almost as if xorg.conf has no effect
press ctrl + alt + backspce to verify it really restarts...
k be back then
ok still have same problem - can't seem to get resolution 1400x1050
xorg.conf file lists it as an option - but the Ubuntu GUI does not
under what circumstances would Xorg not follow what's listed in the xorg.conf file?
if there is a mistake in the config
is there anyway to tell if there is a mistake in the config?
any logs or anything?
maybe in the xorg logs
but your Problem also could be also another thing
I think this is because my ati driver is not reporting what's in the xorg.conf
in the log file it says: (WW) RADEON(0): Mode 1400x1050 is out of range.
going to try re-install of latest driver
maybe it'll help
ladnexem: I was going to run beryl on my ati card - there are probs?
I am not shure were the problem lays
